story:
Pop Rockz World

Pop Rockz World is an iOS multiplayer game that simulates the music entertainment industry.

Players start off virtually unknown in Pop Rockz World but with talent, hard work and a bucketful of luck, you will slowly climb your way up the fame ladder. Along the long ardous road to stardom, you will have to bask in parks and take on gigs in pubs. When you finally gain some fanship, you will be invited to perform at TV shows and grand stadiums to sell-out crowds. With fame comes money, and you can gradually afford snazzier threads, buy pretty instruments, drive fancy cars and stay in swanky apartments.

And on the path to fame and glory, you must continually pick up new skills to improve your performances, release singles to increase your star power and pit yourself against other players in the Pop Rockz Arena to prove who’s better than who!

But once you become a star—if ever you do— will you continue to bask in your glory with millions of wild, screaming fans or will you sink back down to oblivion? If that happens, tough luck -- that’s life in the Pop Rockz World! 

Celebs

Celebrities are a big part of Pop Rockz World, naturally. Players can have fun spotting their celebrities, interacting with them and even picking up some star tips from them!

Performances

It's not truly the music industry without performances. In fact, it's the lifeblood of the industry itself, where new talents get discovered and super stars exalt to god-like status on stage. Players start their performances from the humble park and gradually unlock more venues.

Single Albums

Players can produce and release music singles to boost their popularity and gain fans. We designed this such that the Player will go through a production process not unlike the real thing - from music production to song writing through to sound engineering and marketing the single.

What's more, after the release of a single, the Player will have a chance of winning an award, gaining loads of fans and even receiving a contract from a major record label to produce an album!

Music School

Players get to learn how to do nifty dance numbers and belt like Steve Tyler or Mariah Carey to razzle and dazzle fans and critics alike. Players will get to boost their stats and gain an edge over the other lazy Players who don't bother to upgrade themselves!

Music Showdowns

Players can challenge their friends or other Players to a music showdown, where the quickest fingers and better musician will walk away with new-found fans, at the expense of the loser!

Fully Customizable Avatars - Clothing, Makeovers, Instruments, Cars

Avatars are fully customizable with fashionable clothes, hairstyles, and even snazzy instruments and cars to boost their stats. 

And Lots More Features and Content

There's a lot more features and content in the works that you are not seeing here, but if you like what you see so far, we can assure you that it's only going to get better!

  

What We Need the Money For

As you can see from the screenshots, we are well into production and we are looking to launch the game within 2012.

We are looking to raise $25,000 for the following -

Marketing - Marketing an iOS game is become increasingly more difficult and expensive. Most of the top spots in the iTunes store are dominated by big companies like Game Loft and Electronic Arts who simply have the bucks to fling into marketing. However, we are smart marketers and we know how to attract eyeballs with a fraction of the budget they have. Our previous game - Lamebo VS. Zombies - was marketed on a shoestring budget but shot up to the Top 20 most downloaded in the US market and several other stores. We are marketing whizs who really know how to market our game. But low budget doesn't mean no budget. We still need a reasonable amount of marketing dollars to give Pop Rockz World the initial push it needs to get noticed and go viral. Please help us give the big boys a run for their money by supporting us.

Creating More Content and Features - One of the best ways to reward our Players, keep our Players coming back and to attract new Players is to continually roll out new content and improving our features. We have a list of addon content such as clothing, instruments, cars and more to roll out and we just need the funds to produce them.

Music - As music is a very important component in this music themed game, we would like to license great music to insert into the game. 

Game Testing - We would like to hire professional game testers to test our game to see if the balancing is well done, so that our Players have a good experience playing our game.

Our priority would be marketing the game to get some traction. If we do not reach our entire funding goal, we will dedicate 70% of the funds towards marketing and the rest towards game testing and balancing. We will then reinvest part of our profits into developing more content and licensing better music.

Perks for You

We have a list of exciting perks as our giveback to our supporters.  You can see them on the right. 

 

Who We Are

Swag Soft is a leading mobile app development company in small sunny Singapore, founded by Aldric Chang and Chee Yong - best known for conceptualizing and creating the multi award-winning Travels of Wiglington and Wenks Virtual World.

 

Aldric is a media industry veteran with more than a decade's worth of experience spanning animation, games, music and digital marketing. Chee Yong is a highly experienced programmer who has spent more than 10 years developing mobile apps and games. 

They are good friends and partners who are passionate about creating fun and engaging games and social media platforms for everyone. Above all, they are passionate about wanting to create life-changing experiences through their products, and eventually offer the less unfortunate an opportunity to change their fates with innovation and creativity. 

We are not just about making money. Giving back to society is equally, if not more important, for us.

Pop Rockz World's success is very important to us as a milestone and an encouragement for us to push ourselves even harder. This will help us get closer to our dreams of creating innovative and engaging products to connect and help the world.

We understand that in order to build the bigger things in life, we need to first build the smaller things - and Pop Rockz World is one of them.  

Please help support us in our endeavor. We promise that you will not be disappointed.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you cannot help support our game at this point, but we would really appreciate it if you would follow us on Facebook, Twitter and share the news of our fundraising to your friends.

Let us know what you think and send us any questions you have in the comments section.

We thank you in advance, and look forward to connecting.

story:
Dungeon Sickness is a 2D top-down view action game developed by the indipendent Orichalcum Games. Your objective is to survive a terrible sickness in an unknown maze and find an explanation for your imprisonment.


The story

The story is very simple, in the beginning at least. You find yourself imprisoned in an unknown dungeon: you don't know where you are, why you are there nor who put you in. Your only goal seems to be finding an exit but soon you will discover other humans populate the dark maze, clueless as much as you; some will be helpful, some will fight against you. Everyone you encounter got sick, and dangerous. Finding your way will not be easy at all.

Content

  • An unforgettable adventure
  • Fast paced gameplay with elements from the best games of the past
  • Dark atmospheres with unique fine pixel art
  • Magic and immersive soundtrack
  • Random generated dungeons
  • Dozens of different entities, either friendly or hostile
  • Hundreds of different items with unique purposes
  • A complex skills and fight system 
  • Intense single player campaign with 40+ every time different dungeons 
  • Both local and online cooperative campaigns available 
  • 1-4 local players for old-style couch games - gamepad supported!
  • Epic LAN parties with up to 16 players
  • A massive multiplayer mode in an even bigger persistent dungeon (coming later)


The game is going to be an exciting single player experience and a gold mine for those who love couch games, cooperative modes and LAN parties.

We tried to create a game experience combining elements from the games we liked in the old days. A dark, possibly anguishing atmosphere with some difficult obstacles and serious threats. No hints, no shortcuts, no tender hugs for the player. We made both personal skill and experience needed in order to progress throughout the dungeons. We inserted many items without focusing too much on the equipment; also, there is no level up. Dungeon sickness is a game based on magic, action and fights which will take you in a one-way ticket journey to the exit.

Platforms and technology

Dungeon Sickness will be released for PC, Mac and Linux. The game has been developed using C# and Monogame.

Why Indiegogo?

We have been playing for years. We just decided to start making a game on our own without a plan: Dungeon Sickness is our opera prima. The project started very soon to be solid, and costy too. We found ourselves with no means to sustain it. We struggled hard to keep writing the code in the past months but we need your help to continue our work and fullfill our goals.


Why do we need your money?

Our primary goal is to complete a stable, playable version with single player campaign and TCP/IP multiplayer. We will use everything we are going to receive for:

Graphic assets: high quality pixel art for in-game animations, GUI, tile sets and effects costs much money and time from our only artist. Help us afford more assets from other talents to speed up the process.

Software: we still lack some basic software tool, which slows down coding and debugging by several orders of magnitude.

Hosting: we have to keep running a website and some dedicated servers.

Massive multiplayer: our desire is to create a persistent dungeon with hundreds of levels in which to meet other players to fight or help in a sort of race to the very exit, running for weeks every time. That is a major part of development and requires extra servers and the work of extra IT personnel, which of course must be paid.

Expansions: we feel such a game should be constantly enriched with extra levels, creatures and game-play features after the first release. We oppose the idea of DLCs with fees, so this means we have to spend the same resources required for initial development for a prolonged amount of time.

Porting: Dungeon Sickness will be released for Windows, Linux and Mac but we would be happy to port it to other platforms. Not mentioning the hard work required for such an effort, we would need appropriate hardware for testing.

What you get

Dungeon Sickness is going to be one of the few (and possibly the only) 2D top-view, not tile-based, action games with a rich single player mode and all classic multiplayer modes available, even on LAN. If you still play games from the ‘90s because it is the only way to enjoy those good old feelings with your friends, you will love our game.

We promise hours on hours of varied and rich gameplay with tons of monsters, levels and items.


Other ways to support us

If you can not help with your money, just spread the voice! Share this campaign with your friends and talk about the game in the forums and on the social networks.

story:
Quick Navigation

       

Think about it

Have you ever thought about your privacy?

Are you are aware of who is all spying on you behind you?

Your data is being watched by

  • Hackers
  • Government Agencies
  • Marketing Agencies
  • Mafias
  • Competitors

Solution?

We are AirSpaceOne, and we have reinvented the technology of online communication and Storage.

With AirSpaceOne you can have your own private server and store all your emails and files in the privacy of your own home or office or Carry it anywhere!

What is AirSpaceOne?

It is the Ultimate New Era Technology to protect your Privacy with a Combination of Three Great Features -

1. Communication:  A Free web based Open Source Email client with Hack free security options like - Military Grade AES 256 Bit Encryption, Password protection for Outgoing Messages,etc.,

2. Storage:  A Free Open Source Cloud Storage  for both Web and iOS with High end security level same as our E-mail Client

3. Server: A pocket size Server with storage capacity up to 2TB which stores your E-mails and Files in your Pocket. There is no monthly recurring fee, which can be bought in outright purchase.


Comparison of AirSpaceOne with Existing E-Mail, Cloud storage & Data Servers.


Quick Navigation: Top ¦ Features ¦ Comparison ¦ D&C ¦ Status ¦ Perks ¦ Career ¦ Refer ¦ FAQ

Features of AirSpaceOne

E-Mail (Powered by RoundCube) & Cloud

Demo of Basic Roundcube E-mail client Available here

  • Free, Open source and Ads Free
  • AES 256 Bit Encryption technology & Option to set Password for your messages and files, only you or recipient can read the content
  • Upload videos on the go. No more worries about limited space in phone / tablet, Instantly uploads all data to server and make room for more videos.
  • No size limit and waiting time for attachments
  • Disposable E-mail ids
  • Conversation mode
  • Advanced search options
  • Powerful  Spam filter
  • Minimalist design works faster in low bandwidth modes and bad internet connections.

Server


  • Own server that can be placed in your Home/workplace or carry wherever you go
  • Plug and Play
  • Can be shared by 5 people at a time
  • Zero monthly fees. Outright purchase in affordable rates.
  • Supports up to 2TB Hard Disc, in which you can store around  300 high quality DVD movies, 250,000 songs, Millions of E-mails and Pictures.
  • Fits in your pocket (140mm*100mm*35mm), carry anywhere
  • Built in Wi-Fi
  • Built in lithium battery- 8 hours of video playback, Can be used as a backup charger for your Mobile Devices
  • Access data without Internet connection, Play videos while in Flight
  • Extreme durability and Maintenance free
  • It’s Green - Low power consumption,hardly emits heat - Prevents Global Warming.

Refer & Win

We need your kind support to make this campaign successful. Kindly refer our campaign to as much as people you could and get Exclusive benefits.  Login with your Indiegogo id and grab your referral link just below the main video.

Top 3 Referrers will get the following prize respectively,

  1. Brand Ambassador Badge + 5 Days Trip to India (Incl. of Air Tickets and Boarding)
  2. Banker Badge + 100 Organic T-shirts with customer Embroidery of your choice
  3. Investor Badge + 50 Organic T-shirts with customer Embroidery of your choice

Apart from the above, everyone will receive 1 complete set of AirSpaceOne(2TB)


Quick Navigation: Top ¦ Features ¦ Comparison ¦ D&C ¦ Status ¦ Perks ¦ Career ¦ Refer ¦ FAQ

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How ASO is safer than other email and cloud clients?

A: Traditional email and Cloud providers like uses their own server in a place full of random people.  The chances are extremely high of your important files falling into somebody else’s hands. With AirSpaceOne you have your own private server that all your emails are sent to that is in the privacy of your own home or office only offering the people you want to have access to it.

Q: Do I need to continuously run my server to get emails? If so, what happens if the power goes out?

A: Yes, you need to continuously run your server to get emails. The server should be connected to a power source at all times in an uninterrupted way. But do not worry, AirSpaceOne servers have a built in lithium battery that won’t let the servers experience any down time due to power shortages. The lithium built in battery allows up to 8 hours of video play back.

Q: Is there any monthly or reoccurring fees?

A: Our email and cloud service is absolutely free. There is only a one time purchase cost for your own private AirSpaceOne server, and you can choose different plans listed in the “Perks Section”.

Q: Can AirSpaceOne have multiple accounts set up on one single server?

A: Yes, You can set up to 5 accounts per server.(We are working to add more accounts)

Q: Why do we need funds?

A: On Average we have to invest 50+ hours per week to get the project completed before December 2013. Funding helps ensure that we reach our deadline as well as making any enhancements possible.  Also, funding helps with marketing expenses to promote the product and ensure the first set of productions of AirSpaceOne servers.


If you have more questions just email us - info@airspaceone.com

story_txt:
Quick Navigation



       

Think about it


Have you ever thought about your privacy? 
Are you are aware of who is all spying on you behind you?
Your data is being watched by






Hackers
Government Agencies
Marketing Agencies
Mafias
Competitors




Solution?
We
are AirSpaceOne, and we have reinvented the technology of online communication
and Storage. 
With
AirSpaceOne you can have your own private server and store all your emails and
files in the privacy of your own home or office or Carry it anywhere!
What is AirSpaceOne?
It is the Ultimate New Era Technology to protect your
Privacy with a Combination of Three Great Features -
1. Communication:
 A Free web based Open Source Email
client with Hack free security options like - Military Grade AES 256 Bit Encryption,
Password protection for Outgoing Messages,etc.,
2. Storage:
 A Free Open Source Cloud Storage  for both Web and iOS with High end security
level same as our E-mail Client
3. Server: A
pocket size Server with storage capacity up to 2TB which stores your E-mails
and Files in your Pocket. There is no monthly recurring fee, which can be
bought in outright purchase.

Comparison of
AirSpaceOne with Existing E-Mail, Cloud storage & Data Servers.

files, only you or recipient can read the content

Upload videos on the go. No more worries about
limited space in phone / tablet, Instantly uploads all data to server and make
room for more videos.
No size limit and waiting time for attachments
Disposable E-mail ids
Conversation mode
Advanced search options
Powerful 
Spam filter
Minimalist design works faster in low bandwidth
modes and bad internet connections.

Own server that can be placed in your Home/workplace or carry wherever you go


Plug and Play


Can be shared by 5 people at a time

Zero monthly fees. Outright purchase in
affordable rates.

Supports up to 2TB Hard Disc, in which you can
store around  300 high quality DVD movies, 250,000 songs, Millions of E-mails and Pictures.


Fits in your pocket (140mm*100mm*35mm), carry
anywhere


Built in Wi-Fi

Built in lithium battery- 8 hours of video
playback, Can be used as a backup charger for your
Mobile Devices
Access data without Internet connection, Play
videos while in Flight
Extreme durability and Maintenance free

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Amir Jabri, I'm 36 and I am a lifelong PC gamer and tinkerer! I've been building crazy inventions since I was born!

Many of us love PC games but only play them in our office! We would love to play them comfortably using our favorite controller (Keyboard and Mouse!) on the nice big TV in our living rooms! Unfortunately till now PC gamers were stuck playing in the office, or compromising by using the less accurate traditional gamepad controller that consoles use.

I've tried many times to use my wireless keyboard and mouse to play games in the living room, but I sadly found that after a few minutes of frustration my wrists hurt from the awkward angles I need to hold the keyboard and mouse. I ended up giving up as many others have.

Recently, I invented an ergonomic keypad and mouse controller that works in the living room! I fell in love with this controller and gaming in the living room, and I now want to share this amazing controller with the rest of the world through indiegogo so that PC gamers can play in their living room! I also wanted a way for everyone to be inspired by designing and ordering exactly the controller that they want and either enjoy making it or have it made to order for them!

Your contributions will inspire me to test and develop this concept further and create an amazing open source living-room PC gaming controller to support the adoption of the open PC gaming platform into our living rooms and the future amazing applications of PC gaming such as virtual reality! This will hopefully inspire the creative PC gamers to develop more entertainment for our living room while using their favorite controllers!

What We Need & What You Get

I don't have any minimum funding goal for backers to recieve their Ergoplay controllers! They will ship as soon as they are ordered and will be recieved within a month! The funding pays for materials and time for research, assembly, shipping, and handling!

The unique thing is that every Ergoplay controller is made exactly how you want! It is infinitely customizable and can be used equally well by right handers and left handed players! Every Ergoplay controller comes with a 3 port USB 2.0 hub and 10 foot cable (you can order a longer one if you need it!). In addition see the extra bonus features that the advanced and pro models comes with!

In addition, I'm so confidant that you will absolutely adore playing with the Ergoplay for hours and hours, that I am offering a full moneyback return guarantee for up to 30 days after recieving your Ergoplay!

The Impact

I would really love to have contact with the PC gaming community, and this project will help me to meet so many amazing people! I've won awards in the technology industry and have completed a Ph.D. in polymer chemistry and computer science previously, so I am a hard worker and committed to getting this done! I will get so much joy out of working on something that will give other people enjoyment in their own homes!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS FROZEN! IF YOU WANT TO BE THE FIRST TO KNOW WHEN WE’LL BE BACK WITH LOST TOWN RELOADED SUBSCRIBE TO OUR NEWSLETTER AND WE'LL GIVE YOU THE GROUP WALLPAPER MEANT FOR BACKERS!

FOR THE FULL STORY, HAVE A LOOK AT THE UPDATE SECTION HERE 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

LA CAMPAGNA E’ CONGELATA! SE VUOI ESSERE IL PRIMO A SAPERE QUANDO LOST TOWN TORNERA’ LIVE  ISCRIVITI ALLA NOSTRA NEWSLETTER E TI MANDEREMO ANCHE LO SPECIALE WALLPAPER PENSATO PER I SOSTENITORI

PER LA SPIEGAZIONE COMPLETA, DAI UN OCCHIO QUI 
------------------------------------------------------------------------
(for the italian version/per la versione in ITALIANO clicca qui)

The beginning of the end

The Town is out there, silent. The Priest, The Mayor, The Doctor and seven others citizens had met to congratulate the Butcher, for he is going to marry the fairest lady of them all. Then the storm came and they decided to stay for the night. 

In the morning they found out they were the only inhabitants of their Town. 

Something happened. Something bad, and it was up to them to find out what it was...and how they could come out of it alive. It was not going to be easy.

Time to regroup, time to start making choices…


What kind of game is this?

In Lost Town you can try to find answers to the many mysteries  lying around while trying to keep alive as many survivors as possible. The game is inspired by TV shows like Lost, The walking Dead, Jericho and the masterful Neil Gaiman narrative. Also, the game tries to capture the mood of some very touching music pieces like Pixies’ Where is my mind, Gary Jules’ Mad World and Dead Island trailer song Breathe Me by Sia.

It’s a survival story, with moments of action, moments of horror and moments of psychological tension. At the end of a desperate week the resulting story will be yours, and yours alone. 

It will all depend on the choices you and your team made, the locations you explored and the dangers you faced.

At endgame, you will be able to compare with other players worldwide to see how far from the truth you have gone.

The first version of the characters' sheet:


Weekisode of the week: Episode 1, The Survivor

In order to promote our creative project, we prepared a series of micro episodes to offer some quick brush strokes, an idea of the personality of some of the survivors before the crisis.

We’ll propose to you one of the characters each week until the end of the Indiegogo campaign. You are free to share it anyway you like, actually you are encouraged to do so. 

At the end of week 2 we'll send out a survey to give you, the first backers, the possibility to choose the final Weekisode character: be an early backer so you can make your vote count!

We hope you will like the idea and the mood of our small stories inside the main story, please keep in mind these are made to give you a taste of the mood of the Town: the final game, as described in this very page, will be a game book, not a movie or a comic book. 

Let the story begin, starting with our first character...




Gameplay

You will choose one out of many characters and you will decide if you want to play alone or with up to three other friends… or strangers. 

The game is divided in seven long days, each day marked by some major happening. Each day is a turn of variable duration, up to the players to decide at the beginning of each game.

During the days, each player will go out and explore one of more than 30 locations of the Town in which the characters will discover terrifying truths about the Town, themselves and the world they live in. 

Exploration is done via reading parts of the story and deciding what to do when different possibilities are available. There will be many. Many. Characters will have different personal stories, different peculiar special abilities and different stats to overcome the difficulties they will encounter.

Each evening (again, game time) the party will gather at their shelter and each player will see a synthesis of what happened to the others. It will be then time to decide what is really happening, coming one step closer to the inevitable end... well, one of them. 

Group decisions will happen via voting different possibilities, which in turn will depend on what the characters found out during their explorations.

By now you know we like choices: there will be 21 endings in the game, some good, some bad, one only the true one. And no, we don't think it's something you guessed already!

The Priest is one of the (10 to 16 ) characters you can choose:


What does SANDBOX mean?

It means that you will be free to choose which location to explore from the map of the town freely, scrolling the map and deciding where your character is going.

Some locations will be available only for certain characters, while others may become explorable only under specific circumstances, but most of them will be available since the beginning of the game.

The locations will play an important role in the story, as they are the places where each player will be able to play individually and make individual choices. There will be a minimum of 30 locations, more if stretch goals are met. 

Each location will contain hazards, dangers, tools and a little piece of truth hidden somewhere in it. Somewhere deep.

Here you can find a shot of our map, it will be fully zoomable and scrollable:


A matter of character(s)

Even if you will be able to play with a maximum of other 3 players you will be able to choose between at least ten iconic characters, more if stretch goals are met, each with individual stories and special locations available only when they are in the team.

You will be allowed to change characters each game day or if your character dies: the character failed, the body count increases, the story moves on… until they all die, or some of them succeed in reaching the final day and facing the ending the group deserved.

Each character has its own public story, a more personal story revealed only when the character is chosen and some shady secret to be found in the Town. 

They will also have a special and very peculiar ability, for instance The Priest thanks to his Guidance from Above will be able to go back one choice once per day. Each character will also have different stats, helping them in some choices, hindering in others. 

Every single character will open special choices in determined locations, so you can never know what will happen to the character you are leading in the place you are going.

Finally, there will be some special characters only available if some conditions are met...

Now, a big smile all of you...



Single and Multi player

Lost Town will be playable both as a single player or as a multi player experience.

In multi player mode, you will be able to play with up to other 3 players for a total of up to 4 players. Each day, each player will choose a character and explore one location. Each night, the group will make together choices about what is happening. Each player needs one copy of the game, but you can pick the "Party of Four!" or "Party of Four Deluxe!" perks to get 4 copies of the game for your group of friends. 

You will be free to play with specific friends or with strangers, and you will be able to invite your friends to play the game with you. You will also be able to play with IA companions if none is available for the pacing you desire.

In single player, the scheme is the same but you will make night choices alone. The experience of gaming will be unhindered by playing alone, it will just be different.

The game accounts for how many players there are and reacts accordingly.

In no case you will be able to see who is choosing which character, but you will know which characters have been chosen. You will not know even if you play with friends: we think it will be far more immersive that way, keeping everybody guessing similar to what happens, from a mood perspective, in Dark Souls games. For the same reason, no messaging system will be implemented. 

Yes, you can phone or text your friend if you want. But you shouldn't and your karma will be strained. 

The multi player component will thus have two aspects: first, your story will be influenced by the choices the other players take and what they find in the Town, second your story will go in the direction you and the other players decide with the night choices while evaluating the evidence you found in your locations' exploring.

The locations, instead, will be individually explored so you don't have to wait for anyone in making your choices at your own pace.

The Graveyard: are you sure you want to be there alone?


What does asynchronous mean?

It means that the group will be able to proceed in the game at the pace they set. There will be the possibility to decide how long each game day will last, so every player will know how much time they have to explore their own location.

Basically, it's how long the Night voting moment will wait for all players to have finished their choices.

When the time will has expired, the game will make the remaining choices for the late players, so nobody is left behind.

For instance, say you set the duration at one real time day. Player 1 ends his exploration at noon, player 2 in the afternoon, player 3 in the evening. Player 4 has not ended his exploration at night because he had to stay at work overnight. 

As the group decided they are fine with waiting for one day maximum, the game engine will make choices for Player 4 so voting can happen at night. The same will happen if someone does not vote in the chosen timeframe.

As each group will be free to set a comfortable day duration, you'll be able to go as quick or slow as you feel like.

Of course, if you are playing alone, none of this matters.

Look at The Bodyguard: does he look like someone who's going to wait forever?

The paper version

Lost Town was born as a party game, this is why we decided to make a multi player game instead of a solo one. The paper game will be a product for you to enjoy with a group of friends. It will be similar, but far simpler, to a role playing game where up to eight players drive the story, and one master-mind plays against them, leading the story in the fair but undoubtedly brutal direction the players chose… 

The game engine will be similar to the one used in the App, based on a simple mechanic of action resolution through a combination of character stats, character assets, random draws from a standard 54 card deck and some tactical choice: each player has some ace up his sleeve, so to speak. 

The party game will be available both as PDF and as paper product, as well as in various e-book formats. The paper form will not be a game book: it will be the party game, both in paper and e-book form.  

It will be made up by two booklets: a player’s guide including the characters and their stat cards and a Narrator guide including a detailed how to play guide, all the locations and special rules and scoring system. 

The paper game will require a couple months more than the App one, as we want to focus on the digital version first.


What do I get for backing this game now?

Your help in funding this game is vital to us so we want to reward it appropriately.

First, value: at all reward (or perk) levels above the first one you will get the full App experience and all of the characters which we’ll ever implement in the game: in the retail version on the digital stores 6 characters will be part of the initial package, while others will be sold separately. You'll get instead 11 minimum including a special one, effectively getting the full game at least 40% cheaper than the comparable value on the stores. Yes, the basic game will cost (a bit) less in the stores, but everybody will need to buy additional characters one by one. Also, no special character for them. The App will be in Android or IOS format, more on other formats below.

Second, exclusive: you will get one very special character exclusive to Indiegogo backers: The Specialist. He's tough, he's armed and he knows what he's doing. This special character is not part of the starting group of survivors, but you will get access to his locations to try and recruit him in your group. This character will not be available out of this Indiegogo campaign and possibly further crowdfunding campaigns, if ever there will be more, which at the moment isn't planned.

Third, respect: you will have the possibility to ask for a complete explanation of the “true” ending just by sending us an email: we will send the answer back to you starting one month after publication of the game on the first store. We consider extremely important that all of the happenings in the Lost Town have a solid explanation and we don’t want you to miss it in case you don’t have the time to find it out by gaming. Which is of course what we suggest… but you are the boss here and you deserve answers, if you so desire.

Fourth, more value: depending on the reward level you choose you will also get a series of other valuables, such as the paper game to live the Lost Town experience at the gaming table with your friends, or the original soundtrack or customized Lost Town deck for playing the paper game… or all of it together! For the ones that really want to invest in our game, there's plenty of choices to impact on some of the game elements, too, or to get away with some personalized reward.

Last but not least, you will help bringing this game to life, knowing that you supported the creation of something new and, we really believe, special.

The Specialist in all his glory:

Here you can find a summary of the Perks you can get in this campaign:


Why we need your support

Lost Town is a pure indie game. We’re self-funding the development, art, writing, and promotion from our own pockets. It’s a big work for a small group of people, some of which full time employed. 

The goal amount we ask is about 50% of what we need to fully develop the game, but we'll put in the rest ourselves if need be.

Our ambition is to fund an independent entertainment studio to bring to life the many peculiar ideas we developed in our years as storytellers and gamers (more of that in our bios). As abused as it may sounds, this is a labor of love, and crowdfunding is our way to prove that it can be done, that our stories deserve a public. 

We want Lost Town to be the best debut we can obtain, and that’s where your support will be invaluable to help pay for professional editing, software and hardware needs, art, licenses, testing, production values and of course your perks! 


This sounds quite complex!

That is because, to our knowledge, such a game has never been done before. The structure of the game is indeed complex but it will be very easy to navigate.

You will be able to read through the story like in a traditional game book, making choices, facing hazards, trying to survive. The staggering amount of different hidden variables is such that replay value will be very high, higher than in any game book you may ever have read: it's a promise.

The Train Station: it's quite complex, but you won't perceive it initially:


Kicking it Forward!

Lost Town adheres to the Kicking It Forward system. Yes, we can use this on Indiegogo, we got approval both from InXile and from Indiegogo. To explain it with the words from the legendary Brian Fargo, the inventor: "Once a project in this program has become profitable, the creator is going to spend this 5% profit, which is their own money, on whatever (crowdfunding) projects they want to support... Ultimately, this is an honor system."

Well, we think it's a great idea, we are men of honor, we choose to do this. We'll tell what we'll sponsor this way. Once again, this will happen only after the game is profitable and on the stores.

                                         

                                                     


Languages

Lost Town will be available in English and Italian. We'd really like to add Spanish language but we'll only do so if the related stretch goal is reached: we want the final version to be professionally proofread and edited, and while we speak Spanish fluently we cannot commit to the cost of the quality check you deserve with the base funding goal. 

Spread the word, share the campaign and help us make it in Spanish too!


Tablets

Of course! The game will be optimized for tablet gaming too, obvious to us but better to spell it out clearly.


Will I be able to play the game on IOS, PC or AMAZON FIREs (TV and Tablets)?

The game will be developed first for standard Android (all recent versions, actual and future).

As the ecosystem is very similar, and as Amazon is making things easy for developers, we'll also develop the game for Kindle Fire, Fire HD and Fire TV (yes!).

Finally, the game will also be developed for IOS, but please remember that the versions will be developed in sequence, Android first, Amazon second and IOS third, we estimate a couple months per conversion.

The version you are reserving here on Indiegogo is the "standard Android" one or the IOS one, your choice: at the moment, these are the systems which we should be able to distribute to international backers. 

Yes, we know there have been issues with IOS distribution before for crowdfunded projects but we made our questions and we are confident we can do it.

If it will be possible at the time of game completion, we WILL allow backers to choose Amazon also, but this is not a promise as it will depend on Amazon policies.

Anyway, the game will be well worth the pain, we promise.

The Mechanic will help us distribute the game. 


Stretch Goals

If we exceed our funding goal we will aim higher: for any stretch goal reached, we will add something special to Lost Town for everybody to enjoy. Share this page, let words fly about the game and you will benefit from a better game yourself!

Also, we'll include some stretch goal not related to money but to Facebook shares as these are a potent way to spread the news.


                                          Let's start with a free one


and here we go with the first addition to your basic party

...another one joins the party...



...a new very special character...



                                                       ...getting Latin...

       ...and there will be more if these are reached...


Add-On

If you like the Lost Town universe, you may want to get some extra goodies independently from your Perk level. If you so choose, just add the amount here below to choose your add-on and we'll provide it for you, but remember to add a note in the donation so we know what you want:

5 € - 7 $ - 4 £  for becoming a decisionmaker: we'll ask for your opinion when we are unsure about something, we estimate a total of 4 surveys minimum;

20 € - 28 $ - 17 £ for the special playing cards deck customized for the Lost Town paper party game (but any standard deck will do, don't worry, it's for collectors). Shipping to EU is included, for other Countries please add 15 $ for shipping.

If the Music! stretch goal (currently not disclosed as there are more pressing goals) will be unlocked, we'll also add music as a separate Add-On.


Our team

FAR Entertainment is a new, small and independent studio that has the ambition to create simple new games and entertainment. We enjoy fantasy and mystery. We love dark moods but only when they are backed by a good story. We are a new studio and this is our first project in professional mobile gaming but we have over twelve years of experience in making and loving games, stories, and stories made with games, although not in the professional field. We also have more than ten years of experience in managing professional projects with clearly defined deadlines and objectives.

It would be very space-heavy to show everybody faces & work here, but you can find it all at our website, you are more than welcome to come and meet us there.


Risks and challenges

This is an ambitious project. It’s the first time, in our honest knowledge, that an App game book includes multi player elements so central to the story, together with a complex sandbox story. 

The main challenges we see is timing: that is why we ask for community support in order to speed thing up by outsourcing non vital parts of the project, and of course the fact that being a first time, risks are present: that is why we are putting all of our energies in making this game the best it can be.

There are safe areas in the Town, like the group's shelter


Your ideas

Of course we welcome your suggestions on Lost Town but please don't propose them if you are going to claim rights in them: be aware that if we use them you won't be able to claim that you own bits of the game. By submitting comments you are agreeing that we can use them and any rights in them in any way we like. Ok, that’s out of the way. 

Visit our site for development updates and check out our Facebook page to join the community of the Lost Town citizens.

Believe in us...the Lost Town is there, waiting...
story_txt:
THE
CAMPAIGN IS FROZEN! IF YOU WANT TO BE THE FIRST TO KNOW WHEN WE’LL BE BACK WITH
LOST TOWN RELOADED SUBSCRIBE TO OUR NEWSLETTER AND WE'LL GIVE YOU THE GROUP WALLPAPER MEANT FOR BACKERS!
FOR THE
FULL STORY, HAVE A LOOK AT THE UPDATE SECTION HERE 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------


LA CAMPAGNA E’ CONGELATA! SE VUOI ESSERE IL PRIMO A SAPERE
QUANDO LOST TOWN TORNERA’ LIVE  ISCRIVITI ALLA NOSTRA NEWSLETTER E TI MANDEREMO ANCHE LO SPECIALE WALLPAPER PENSATO PER I SOSTENITORI
PER LA SPIEGAZIONE COMPLETA, DAI UN OCCHIO QUI 
------------------------------------------------------------------------(for the italian version/per la versione in ITALIANO clicca qui)
The beginning of the endThe Town is out there, silent. The Priest, The Mayor, The Doctor and seven others citizens had met to congratulate the Butcher, for he is going to marry the fairest lady of them all. Then the storm came and they decided to stay for the night. In the morning they found out they were the only inhabitants of their Town. Something happened. Something bad, and it was up to them to find out what it was...and how they could come out of it alive. It was not going to be easy.Time to regroup, time to start making choices…What kind of game is this?In Lost Town you can try to find answers to the many mysteries  lying around while trying to keep alive as many survivors as possible. The game is inspired by TV shows like Lost, The walking Dead, Jericho and the masterful Neil Gaiman narrative. Also, the game tries to capture the mood of some very touching music pieces like Pixies’ Where is my mind, Gary Jules’ Mad World and Dead Island trailer song Breathe Me by Sia.It’s a survival story, with moments of action, moments of horror and moments of psychological tension. At the end of a desperate week the resulting story will be yours, and yours alone. It will all depend on the choices you and your team made, the locations you explored and the dangers you faced.At endgame, you will be able to compare with other players worldwide to see how far from the truth you have gone.The first version of the characters' sheet:Weekisode of the week: Episode 1, The SurvivorIn order to promote our creative project, we prepared a series of micro episodes to offer some quick brush strokes, an idea of the personality of some of the survivors before the crisis.We’ll propose to you one of the characters each week until the end of the Indiegogo campaign. You are free to share it anyway you like, actually you are encouraged to do so. At the end of week 2 we'll send out a survey to give you, the first backers, the possibility to choose the final Weekisode character: be an early backer so you can make your vote count!We hope you will like the idea and the mood of our small stories inside the main story, please keep in mind these are made to give you a taste of the mood of the Town: the final game, as described in this very page, will be a game book, not a movie or a comic book. Let the story begin, starting with our first character...GameplayYou will choose one out of many characters and you will decide if you want to play alone or with up to three other friends… or strangers. The game is divided in seven long days, each day marked by some major happening. Each day is a turn of variable duration, up to the players to decide at the beginning of each game.During the days, each player will go out and explore one of more than 30 locations of the Town in which the characters will discover terrifying truths about the Town, themselves and the world they live in. Exploration is done via reading parts of the story and deciding what to do when different possibilities are available. There will be many. Many. Characters will have different personal stories, different peculiar special abilities and different stats to overcome the difficulties they will encounter.Each evening (again, game time) the party will gather at their shelter and each player will see a synthesis of what happened to the others. It will be then time to decide what is really happening, coming one step closer to the inevitable end... well, one of them. Group decisions will happen via voting different possibilities, which in turn will depend on what the characters found out during their explorations.By now you know we like choices: there will be 21 endings in the game, some good, some bad, one only the true one. And no, we don't think it's something you guessed already!The Priest is one of the (10 to 16 ) characters you can choose:What does SANDBOX mean?It means that you will be free to choose which location to explore from the map of the town freely, scrolling the map and deciding where your character is going.Some locations will be available only for certain characters, while others may become explorable only under specific circumstances, but most of them will be available since the beginning of the game.The locations will play an important role in the story, as they are the places where each player will be able to play individually and make individual choices. There will be a minimum of 30 locations, more if stretch goals are met. Each location will contain hazards, dangers, tools and a little piece of truth hidden somewhere in it. Somewhere deep.Here you can find a shot of our map, it will be fully zoomable and scrollable:A matter of character(s)Even if you will be able to play with a maximum of other 3 players you will be able to choose between at least ten iconic characters, more if stretch goals are met, each with individual stories and special locations available only when they are in the team.You will be allowed to change characters each game day or if your character dies: the character failed, the body count increases, the story moves on… until they all die, or some of them succeed in reaching the final day and facing the ending the group deserved.Each character has its own public story, a more personal story revealed only when the character is chosen and some shady secret to be found in the Town. They will also have a special and very peculiar ability, for instance The Priest thanks to his Guidance from Above will be able to go back one choice once per day. Each character will also have different stats, helping them in some choices, hindering in others. Every single character will open special choices in determined locations, so you can never know what will happen to the character you are leading in the place you are going.Finally, there will be some special characters only available if some conditions are met...Now, a big smile all of you...Single and Multi playerLost Town will be playable both as a single player or as a multi player experience.In multi player mode, you will be able to play with up to other 3 players for a total of up to 4 players. Each day, each player will choose a character and explore one location. Each night, the group will make together choices about what is happening. Each player needs one copy of the game, but you can pick the "Party of Four!" or "Party of Four Deluxe!" perks to get 4 copies of the game for your group of friends. You will be free to play with specific friends or with strangers, and you will be able to invite your friends to play the game with you. You will also be able to play with IA companions if none is available for the pacing you desire.In single player, the scheme is the same but you will make night choices alone. The experience of gaming will be unhindered by playing alone, it will just be different.The game accounts for how many players there are and reacts accordingly.In no case you will be able to see who is choosing which character, but you will know which characters have been chosen. You will not know even if you play with friends: we think it will be far more immersive that way, keeping everybody guessing similar to what happens, from a mood perspective, in Dark Souls games. For the same reason, no messaging system will be implemented. Yes, you can phone or text your friend if you want. But you shouldn't and your karma will be strained. The multi player component will thus have two aspects: first, your story will be influenced by the choices the other players take and what they find in the Town, second your story will go in the direction you and the other players decide with the night choices while evaluating the evidence you found in your locations' exploring.The locations, instead, will be individually explored so you don't have to wait for anyone in making your choices at your own pace.The Graveyard: are you sure you want to be there alone?

It means that the group will be able to proceed in the game at the pace they set. story:
eigoMANGA is a production and publishing company that specializes in creating original comic books, animation, and digital media. The company formed an independent game development studio in January 2011 to localize and publish independent Japanese games.

Vanguard Princess is eigoMANGA's first game release. The game is a classic 2D fighting game for the PC that features an all-female cast each with their own unique fighting style. The game is created by Tomoaki Sugeno.

We're all excited that players all over the globe are playing Vanguard Princess on Steam.

  • Vanguard Princess launched on Steam in March of 2014 and is actively played by Steam gamers in approximately 131 countries.
  • There is an absolute need for a netplay component to this game. Indie developers and hobbyists have been trying to create a solid one for years.
  • The current netplay applications developed for Vanguard Princess (Lunaport and MSTP) are too complicated for average gamers, doesn't have a dedicated server, and doesn't work for Steam. 
  • We have set up an Indiegogo campaign that will reward the developers who create solid a Netplay application that will work on the Steam version of Vanguard Princess.

Developers' Guide

  • Developers can download the Vanguard Princess Developer Tool Kit to gain the necessary files to start developing the Netplay application. 
  • Developers have general creative and technical freedom on how they would like to develop the Netplay application.
  • Developers can submit their applications to business@eigoMANGA.com.
  • The winning application must be easy for every gamer to use, have a creative yet professional UI/UX design, and it must work with the Steam version of Vanguard Princess.
  • The Netplay Application will be a free DLC on Steam.

Download the Vanguard Princess Developer Tool Kit

Campaign Incentives

We have a campaign goal of $10,000 (USD) we want to reach with your help. Your support is greatly appreciated to the extent that we have exciting benefits and incentives based on your level of contribution. 

Take a look at some of our choice incentives:

Exclusive Gamer Server Access And Game Assets Perks ($50)

  • Get a copy of Vanguard Princess for Steam
  • Early Access to the Beta DLC
  • AccessVanguard Princess Netplay dedicated server
  • Exclusive Steam assets such as wallpapers
  • Trading cards, backgrounds, and emoticons
  • The original game soundtrack
  • Game assets such as levels and stages
  • Character sprite sheet of every playable character
  • A special Thank You card

Producer Title And San Diego Comic-Con 2013 Perks ($1,000)

  • Get all of the previous perks 
  • 4-day Industry Pass to Anime Expo 2014*
  • 5-day Guest Pass to San Diego Comic-Con 2014*
  • 'Producer' title in the game credits
  • Access to Netplay Developer's Blog
  • Exclusive Vanguard Princess Poster
  • Exclusive Vanguard Princess T-Shirt
  • Official Vanguard Princess MONOPOLY Board Game
  • Limited Edition Yui import figurine
  • Limited Edition Luna import figurine


Frequently Asked Questions: 

Why Is The Campaign Goal $10,000?

We've been approached by several game development firms in the past to add a multiplayer component to Vanguard Princess. The average range of bids was $10,000.

If we raise the goal but fail to find a winning Netplay application then we will contract the project to a game studio that specializes in online multiplayer game development to take over the project.

A solid Netplay DLC for Vanguard Princess will get done because it's needed.

Isn't There Already A Vanguard Princess Netplay Out There?

There are great Netplay application for Vanguard Princess such as Lunaport and MTSP. The challenge with those applications is that they are really hard for average gamers to use; they have to be familiar with their computer's network settings and sometimes have to reconfigure them.


Also for these applications to work with players over the internet both players have to have the same version of Vanguard Princess and be in sync, which means their file sizes and game settings have to be the same. 

And lastly, there isn't a dedicated server anywhere to host Vanguard Princess netplay on a large scale.  All of these issues just makes netplay too complicated for average gamers.

We want a Netplay DLC that makes it easy for anyone to play against others online. Steam is ideal for Vanguard Princess Netplay because Steam's cloud-base platform allows its community of gamers to have updates and synced versions of the game automatically. Through Steam, players get updates to the game; with a Netplay DLC in place, they can find, sync with, and play against other Vanguard Princess gamers over the internet.

Call To Action:

Let's Rally Together For A Better Vanguard Princess Game Experience

  • Since 2009, Vanguard Princess has built a loyal international following of gamers.
  • Fans rallied together to successfully vote Vanguard Princess into Steam through Greenlight in October 2013.
  • Vanguard Princess is now played by gamers in approximately 131 countries.

Vanguard Princess deserves a netplay feature, so let's come together and reward the developers out there who are talented, passionate, and skilled enough to make the Vanguard Princess an even better gaming experience.




Announcement: 

eigoMANGA Is Organizing A 4-Day Vanguard Princess Hackathon At FanimeCon 2014 In San Jose, CA 

Fans of Vanguard Princess are invited to hack and develop content to improve the game. The emphasis is to develop a highly requested online multiplayer support for the game. Get access to developer tools, form a team, then hack away throughout FanimeCon! The best demos will win prizes. Sign up for the Hackathon


The 3-Day Hackathon will be hosted at FanimeCon (The Fairmont - Downtown San Jose, CA)

Day - 1 (Kickoff)
Friday, May 23, 2014 in Panel Room #3

Day - 2 (Hack Day and Coach Support)
Saturday, May 24, 2014 in Panel Room #3

Day - 3 (Demo Night)
Sunday, May 25, 2014 in Panel Room #3

On Demo Night, Hackathon teams will present their demos to the public as well as a panel of judges. The best demos will win prizes.

The top prize for the best Netplay application could be a share of the Indiegogo Campaign Funds.

Sign Up For The Hackathon

*Passes to San Diego Comic-Con or Anime Expo 2014 does not include travel and hotel accommodations.

eigoMANGA is a production and publishing company that specializes in creating original comic books, animation, and digital media. The company formed an independent game development studio in January 2011 to localize and publish independent Japanese games.Vanguard Princess is eigoMANGA's first game release. The game is a classic 2D fighting game for the PC that features an all-female cast each with their own unique fighting style. The game is created by Tomoaki Sugeno.We're all excited that players all over the globe are playing Vanguard Princess on Steam.

Vanguard Princess launched on Steam in March of 2014 and is actively played by Steam gamers in approximately 131 countries.
There is an absolute need for a netplay component to this game. Indie developers and hobbyists have been trying to create a solid one for years.
The current netplay applications developed for Vanguard Princess (Lunaport and MSTP) are too complicated for average gamers, doesn't have a dedicated server, and doesn't work for Steam.

story:
(I apologize in advance for the terrible commentary in the two videos, I am a developer, not a voiceactor or commentator)

  • Hi, my name is Magnus Ekeli.
  • I am a graduate of game design and environment art (Masters), and after being in various jobs and projects for a while, I am ready to create something of my own.
  • I have worked on my game "Modulated" for a long time as a side project while I studied and worked. But it has reached a point where I need to work at it as a full job to complete it, and that means covering living expenses.
  • If I can get the funding needed, I will see to it that the game gets all the attention it needs and gets developed quickly and efficiently.
  • Without your help, this game will probably never be finished and be forgotten, a new indie development business in a country which sorely needs more love for the art of video games will never get established.
  • It is about so much more than just the game.

If you have any questions or just want to talk, join our Facebook Group.

Thank you for your time so far! :D


Modulated is a Mech Combat simulator.
It's a game where you put together your own mech, and try it out against other mechs.
The game focuses a lot on planned tactical and strategic movement rather than neccesarily twitch reflexes.

It is currently being developed for PC using the Unreal Development kit, but I am willing to look at spreading the game for more platforms should the game be successful and the platform be viable after the game has been released.


The goals of the game are as follows:
  • Customization. Not only will you be able to customize over 18 different parts of your mech, you will also be able to customize its paintjob to create your unique style.
  • Arena. Herein lies the core game, bring your creation to various arenas to fight for different prizes.
  • Rivals. Mechs will have recognizable names, tactics and setups, each having different ways to be defeated. You will remember who destroyed your mech last time, and be ready for revenge.
  • Tournaments. Join large tournaments ending in a single duel against the top mech, for greater and unique rewards.
  • Rankings. As you work your way up, compare your statistics and fighting prowess to the other mech pilots in the game.
  • Challenges. As your name gets more known, pilots will start challenging you to duels where you will fight for parts of each other's mechs.

Now these are the base goals of the game, there are a lot more features that I would love to implement and that the game has been designed to support.
These are:

  • Research tree. Develop your own parts by researching and crafting from scraps gained from your defeated opponents.
  • Exploration, explore the world, scavenge for unique parts and fight bandit mechs and ancient, collossus mechs roaming the world. Trade with and fight for various factions.
  • Multiplayer support: Test your design against your friends!
  • And more..!

However, these features will take of funding (or rather, time) to implement, and will only be doable as stretch goals, or should the game be financially successful after it's release.

Yes, that's right, I wish to continue to add to the game and improve it after it's "done".

You can find a very, early alpha at Desura! 

Please keep in mind that it is a mere skeleton of the game, with no progress, a lot of placeholder art, and lots of bugs.

Check out the gallery for more screenshots and a trailer!

When you are working on something full time, regardless of how little expenses the project itself has, there are expenses to cover.
  • First of all, living costs. Most of the funding will go to cover living costs during the development period, however, I will be living very cheaply, and the funds will only cover cheap, basic food, shelter and power, in order to maximize the potential of the funds, and so that you don't feel I am spending the money on myself.
    Think of it as funds for development time.
  • Safety net. There will always be unexpected expenses and opportunities, a little extra of the fund goes to this.
  • Extras. And at last there is a bit dedicated to things like covering the perks, some occasional outsourcing to things I cannot cover myself, like voiceover and music, and help that may speed up the process.

  • If the complete goal isn't reached, the game will get developed as far as the funds go, the game will then be released as an early access version for sale (perks will still be valid!), and the game will continue to be developed as long as sales and support cover continued development.


  • I am an indie game designer and environment artist who graduated with a masters degree not to long ago.
  • I have done several smaller projects before (nothing big or commercial), and I have seen, experienced and learned what people do wrong and what to avoid, I am finally ready to create my own proper game.

I understand that to you, this is probably "just another indie game". But to me, getting through this successfully means a lot.

  • I will finally be able to fullfill my dreams of becoming an indie game developer and create my own games.
  • I will be able to establish a proper indie game company that can expand over time and give opportunities to others like me for jobs in the future.
  • This is what I burn for, what I want to do, and nothing compares to this.
    I will give the game and indie game company my full attention, gladly!

It is always risky to develop something with a small team, let alone on your own.
You need to be able to cover all areas of development, which is very difficult and time consuming for one person, but doable if you start small and have the experience neccessary.

  • While my education is within the general setup of a game and it's visuals, I do have quite a bit of experience with games programming, as I have been programming a lot on my previous projects. I have been able to put my game together efficiently without too many issues so far.
  • I have however, very little experience with sound design. But I do aim for high quality sounds and music. I believe I have managed to cover the sounds of the game pretty well, but I will need funding for proper soundtracks.
  • Another problem is time evaluation, when you are many people working on the same project, time lost by an individual get mitigated by the whole team. When you are stuck and alone, any time spent on solving issues is time 100% lost. This means that work that was meant to take 1 day can quickly take 3 days to a week. I currently plan on releasing the first version of the game some time during the summer 2015. But should the game not be complete, I will start selling it as an early access version, and keep developing until it is complete.


If you share this on twitter or facebook, or just mention it to your friends, it will help a lot!

I'd argue that it is in fact more important than anything else you can do!

So please do anything you can to help me get this project known, it might be the factor that makes it a reality!

story:
Who Are You, and What Is "Oblivious"?

We are Active Captivation Games, a new live action gaming company founded by graduate students at California Institute of the Arts. Our squad is made of young theater artists and game makers (and players!). We fuse theater and video game play to create interactive experiences that depend on the audience to carry the story. We are particularly focused on forging new relationships within our audience through technology and the teamwork that is necessary to win a game.

Our theatrical backgrounds compel us to create experiences that plunge audiences into immersive environments; as gamemakers, we demand that the players carry the story. As a result, our ambition is to build exciting realities where the audience is a player, and interacts with the environment to unfold the story as they experience it. As an essential component to the life of the story, the player will feel captivated by their surroundings and the role they play in them. 

Oblivious is our premiere game, developed and directed by our awesome game director Jen . It takes place in a cyberpunk dystopia, a place called the United Nation States of Surveillance. The experience will be intimate; ten audience players and three players chosen at random right before the performance by an actor portraying a UNSS Officer. During the game the players work together to defeat CaNDOS, the robot overseer of the UNSS. CaNDOS will be a live non-playable character played by Jen. There will be three rounds the players have to collaborate through to disable the surveillance state and overthrow CaNDOS. The gameplay structure takes many ideas from the classic video game style- we even have a final boss! But beware, because the rounds are timed; take your sweet time and CaNDOS will catch on to you and kick you out! Another player will be chosen from the audience by the UNSS Officer. 

Oblivious is a fun futuristic game that explores the question: If we continue to use technology unethically, what consequences will our society face? Definitely a great way for Active Captivation Games to make its debut.

Project Goals- And What's In It For Me?

Our goal is to put this thing up as a part of the New Works Festival at CalArts in late April. Although we have a full production team we can not move forward with having their ideas realized without materials to build set, costumes, and electronics that will make the experience truly interactive. Donations also go towards an immersive sound design; untraditional lighting; and ambient projections. 

So what's in it for our supporters? Well other than the perks listed to the right on your screen (ahem, the opposite way than what we pointed to in the video), you get to support a budding company that has great potential to bring in new art to LA that unites theater-goers, art lovers, and gamers alike. High five!

**UPDATE: if we reach our funding goal and get 100 Facebook likes, we will have a launch party after the opening experience with BEER.**

Risks & Challenges

Other than figuring out effective staging, electronics, and production design, our biggest challenge is in getting word about Active Captivation Games, as well as funding, and more importantly building a fanbase! We are hoping to overcome this through active use of social media, and word of mouth at CalArts and in the art scene in Los Angeles. And through our good looks and pure awesomeness of course.

I Don't Even Have Five Dollars! How Can I Help?

Give us a shout on our facebook or twitter page! Let us know who is interested in our success: 

https://twitter.com/activecaptiv
https://www.facebook.com/activcaptivgames
Use the hashtags #acgames and #oblivious along with useful ones like #ilovela #calarts #gaming. 
Follow us on social media and come be a part of Oblivious in April!

story:
Warzone


The most unique multiplayer game , help us by making our imagination become a reality :)
Why the name "Warzone"?
In the middle of the map , there is an area that contains all the weapons , and it's where all players are supposed to meet and fight , we call it the "Warzone" .
What makes "Warzone interesting"?
8 players -> 4 gates  -> 20 weapons .
You can enjoy playing with friends in peace and have fun ,or you can challenge them .
Why do we need money ?
We have been working for 4 months , small team of two young entrepreneurs  , we can finish the game as soon as we can , but what's the point ? no one will look at it, and as you saw we don't need a lot of money, our goal is the minimum but every dollar will help us produce a better quality in  much less time , we have  dreams , and you can help us achieve them .
What's in it for you?
for 1$ : Your name will be mentioned in in-game credits .
3$ : One copy of the game +  Your name will be mentioned in in-game credits .
10$ : everything before , we will make sure to highlight your email , maybe give you special discounts in the future , and your name as a cheat code in-game.
20$ : it'll mean a lot to us , everything before plus our next project for free ! .
story_txt:
Warzone

The most unique multiplayer game , help us by making our imagination become a reality :)
Why the name "Warzone"?
In the middle of the map , there is an area that contains all the weapons , and it's where all players are supposed to meet and fight , we call it the "Warzone" .
What makes "Warzone interesting"?
8 players -> 4 gates  -> 20 weapons .
You can enjoy playing with friends in peace and have fun ,or you can challenge them .
Why do we need money ?
We have been working for 4 months , small team of two young entrepreneurs  , we can finish the game as soon as we can , but what's the point ? no one will look at it, and as you saw we don't need a lot of money, our goal is the minimum but every dollar will help us produce a better quality in  much less time , we have  dreams , and you can help us achieve them .
What's in it for you?
for 1$ : Your name will be mentioned in in-game credits .
3$ : One copy of the game +  Your name will be mentioned in in-game credits .
10$ : everything before , we will make sure to highlight your email , maybe give you special discounts in the future , and your name as a cheat code in-game.
20$ : it'll mean a lot to us , everything before plus our next project for free ! .

story:
Short Summary

We're Ronan, Dav, Eoin, Hudson, Siskey and Nick - AKA Team Midway. We used to run a live-action role-playing game called Midway for two years ending in 2013.

Midway was set in a post-apocalyptic world. We used both rubber swords and airsoft guns for combat and ran 23 episodes over our two years. We believe that we gently nudged LARPing in Ireland forward by proving to people that there was an audience for an independent ongoing game of this type.

We miss that game, and we think some of our players do too. So we thought we'd like to run a "once-off" game with the same rules in the same universe - A Return To Midway. We want once again to push the envelope of what we think we can do as a team and provide a memorable game as well as inspiration for other people to organise their own events.

We have already met with Red Barn airsoft site in North County Dublin and have a date and time provisionally booked:


Saturday May 21st 2016, 4pm - Midnight


Plot

In creating a new Midway game we knew we wanted to make something "once-off" rather than the start of another ongoing game - we have other commitments! Considering that the vast majority of characters from our ongoing game didn't make it out alive and neither did the settlement, we have a "blank slate" - the "Return to Midway" isn't literal. Rather, the events of this game concern a small trade caravan, far away from the settlements featured in the original Midway game...

Hernandez' Caravan is a new trade company, travelling between the settlements of Iron Oak and Whiteland.  For the three months that it has been operating, the caravan has always traveled around an area of land known as Bonemoor. Bonemoor is the subject of several ghost stories and legends - enough to keep any sane traveller well away. But the price is right, so on this one journey the caravan will track straight through.


What We Need & What You Get

We hope that there will be players for Return to Midway, but we feel like the kind of game we want to run is not a game for ten people. We decided that we'd only run the game to a group of more than thirty people. Our target for this campaign is thirty players times the cost of a ticket - if we end up hitting the target with less people due to other perks, that's fine too. So what we need is for you to promise us that you're coming by buying a ticket.

What you get is an evening's entertainment. Your support for Return to Midway goes entirely into the game - we've never been about making a profit. Of the cost of a €25 ticket, €20 goes directly to Red Barn and €5 toward the running of the game - printing costs, admin costs (like our Indiegogo campaign), laminating and props.


Why We Need YOU

We've done this before. Team Midway have been responsible for hundreds of hours of gaming entertainment as individuals, and for twenty-eight separate games as a team, ranging from four-hour episodes to forty-eight hour epics. We're already in touch with our site, who are fully in agreement with our plans and who will provide insurance for us. 
But without you - yes, you! - it's not going to happen. Red Barn's a big enough site when it's pitch black, and we've seen small groups get swallowed up by it before now. That's why we're setting minimum numbers. If we don't get them, we won't run the game and we'll be very sad.


Risks & Challenges

Short of more than half of the team getting hit by a bus we can't think of anything that stands in the way of doing this, bar you - our audience - not wanting us to. Our rules are already written and have been tested over a lot of games. We have the complete support of our site partner. Rather than spend time putting rules together and chasing a site we'd like to spend the time we have in development of the best experience we can.


Stretch Goals

If we manage to raise more than the money we need to run this game it will go straight back into running the game - if and when we meet our goal we'll announce what happens if we just get a teeny bit further. Stay tuned for updates!


I Can't Go - How Else Can I Help?

That's a terrible shame - we'll miss you! If you want to help us out, though, spread the word about the game as far and wide as you can! We'll be doing the same but we'll take all the help we can get.
